item.title: 金融系统网络攻击激增，巴西央行誓言制定更严格的规则
item.description: 巴西央行监管总监艾尔顿-阿基诺（Ailton Aquino）周三表示，巴西央行正准备推进加强对金融系统的监管，以遏制网络攻击的增加。【原文：Brazil's central bank is preparing to advance tighter regulation of the financial system to curb a rise in cyberattacks, the bank's supervision director, Ailton Aquino, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田开设美国电池厂，确认高达 100 亿美元的投资计划
item.description: 丰田汽车周三表示，其投资 139 亿美元的北卡罗来纳州电池厂已开始生产，并确认计划五年内在美国投资 100 亿美元。【原文：Toyota Motor on Wednesday said it had begun production at its $13.9 billion North Carolina battery plant and confirmed it plans to invest up to $10 billion over five years in the United States.】

item.title: 制裁阻碍卢克石油公司在罗马尼亚黑海的钻探计划
item.description: 奥斯陆上市公司 Vantage Drilling 取消了明年的钻探合同，两名业内人士周三告诉路透社，该合同是与受制裁的俄罗斯石油巨头卢克石油公司签订的，用于勘探其在罗马尼亚黑海发现的三叉戟天然气。【原文：Oslo-listed Vantage Drilling cancelled a contract to drill next year, which two industry sources told Reuters on Wednesday was with sanctioned Russian oil major Lukoil for exploration at its Romanian Black Sea Trident gas discovery.】

item.title: 报告称，监管明朗后，有收益的加密资产有望增长
item.description: 区块链公司RedStone在周三的一份报告中表示，随着《GENIUS法案》通过后机构采用加密货币的速度加快，加密货币市场的收益资产有望迅速增长。【原文：Yield-bearing assets in the cryptocurrency market are expected to grow rapidly as institutional adoption accelerates after the passage of the GENIUS Act, blockchain firm RedStone said in a report on Wednesday.】

item.title: 威廉姆斯：美联储可能很快开始购买债券以管理市场流动性
item.description: 纽约联储主席约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周三重申，作为维持对短期利率控制的技术性努力的一部分，美国央行不得不重启债券购买的时间越来越近。【原文：New York Federal Reserve President John Williams reiterated on Wednesday the time is getting closer when the U.S. central bank will have to restart bond purchases as part of a technical effort to maintain control over short-term interest rates.】

item.title: Synopsys 将在重大重组中裁员约 10
item.description: 根据周三提交的一份监管文件，Synopsys 将裁员约 10%，即大约 2000 人，因为这家芯片设计软件制造商希望将投资转向增长机会。【原文：Synopsys will lay off about 10% or roughly 2,000 employees, as the chip-design software maker looks to redirect investment towards growth opportunities, according to a regulatory filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: GlobalFoundries 预计本季度汽车和数据中心芯片需求乐观
item.description: 受汽车和数据中心市场客户强劲需求的推动，合约芯片制造商 GlobalFoundries 周三预测第四季度利润和收入将高于华尔街预期。【原文：Contract chipmaker GlobalFoundries forecast fourth-quarter profit and revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by strong demand from its clients in the automotive and data center markets.】

item.title: 银行监管机构称，欧盟现有加密货币规则可应对稳定币风险
item.description: 在欧洲中央银行警告稳定币可能威胁金融稳定之后，欧洲的银行监管机构告诉路透社，欧洲现有的加密货币规则已经包含了防范稳定币风险的措施。【原文：Europe's existing crypto rules already contain safeguards against risks posed by stablecoins, the region's banking supervisor told Reuters, after the European Central Bank warned that the tokens could threaten financial stability.】

item.title: 金-卡戴珊的 Skims 公司以 50 亿美元的估值获得新一轮融资
item.description: 由电视真人秀明星兼企业家金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）和詹斯-格雷德（Jens Grede）共同创立的 Skims 公司周三表示，该公司已筹集到 2.25 亿美元的新资金，使该塑身衣品牌的估值达到 50 亿美元。【原文：Skims, founded by reality TV star and entrepreneur Kim Kardashian along with Jens Grede, said on Wednesday it had raised $225 million in new capital, valuing the shapewear label at $5 billion.】

item.title: 吉尔吉斯斯坦推出 5000 万美元的国家稳定币代币
item.description: 吉尔吉斯斯坦金融监管机构本周表示，该国已发行了价值超过 5000 万美元的国家稳定币 USDKG，该币以黄金为支撑，与美元挂钩。【原文：Kyrgyzstan has launched over $50 million worth of its national stablecoin, USDKG, backed by gold and pegged to the U.S. dollar, the country’s financial regulator said this week.】

item.title: Coinbase 将在得克萨斯州重新成立公司
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Coinbase 在周三提交的一份文件中表示，该公司将在新的商业中心德克萨斯州重新注册成立，并将离开特拉华州。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is reincorporating in the new business hub of Texas, and is set to leave Delaware, the company said in a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国财政部长贝森特将在费城造币厂铸造最后一枚便士
item.description: 财政部表示，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）和财政部长布兰登-比奇（Brandon Beach）将于周三访问费城造币厂，监督最终流通的一美分硬币或便士的生产，每枚硬币的生产成本接近 4 美分。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Treasurer Brandon Beach will visit the Philadelphia Mint on Wednesday to oversee production of the final circulating one-cent coin or penny, each of which costs nearly 4 cents to produce, Treasury said.】

item.title: 加拿大 Loblaw 公司上调年度利润预期，原因是杂货需求强劲
item.description: 加拿大零售商 Loblaw 周三上调了其年度利润预期，第三季度利润超过预期，该零售商押注在经济不确定的情况下，其折扣店的杂货和药品需求仍将保持弹性。 该零售商对 Maxi 和 No Frills 等折扣品牌的重视，以及以价值为导向的计划，如保持低价和推出积极的促销活动，帮助吸引了更多有预算意识的加拿大人。【原文：Loblaw raised its annual profit forecast after beating third-quarter profit estimates on Wednesday, as the Canadian retailer bet on demand for grocery and medicines at its discount stores to remain resilient amid economic uncertainties. The retailer's focus on discount banners such as Maxi and No Frills and value-driven programs like keeping prices low and rolling out aggressive promotions has helped attract more budget-conscious Canadians.】

item.title: 欧佩克认为 2026 年石油市场趋于平衡，进一步偏离赤字预测
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）周三发布的一份报告显示，明年世界石油供应有望与需求相匹配，这反映了欧佩克+组织（OPEC+ Group）的增产情况，标志着该组织进一步改变了早先对2026年供应短缺的预测。【原文：World oil supply is expected to match demand next year in a reflection of the wider OPEC+ group's production increases, an OPEC report showed on Wednesday, marking a further shift from its earlier projections of a supply deficit in 2026.】

item.title: 大多数经济学家表示，美联储将在 12 月因就业市场疲软而再次降息
item.description: 路透社调查显示，80%的经济学家认为，美国联邦储备委员会下月将再次下调关键利率25个基点，以支撑疲软的劳动力市场。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will again lower its key interest rate by 25 basis points next month to underpin a weakening labor market, according to 80% of economists polled by Reuters, up slightly from a poll taken last month.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，白宫正在探索颠覆股东投票的规则
item.description: 华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道称，白宫正在探索新的措施，以遏制代理顾问和指数基金经理的影响力。【原文：The White House is exploring new measures to curb the influence of proxy advisers and index-fund managers, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧盟期待大科技公司和有影响力的人打击混合威胁和假新闻
item.description: 由于对外国政府干预国家选举的担忧，欧盟委员会周三提出了一项战略，欧洲正寻求网络平台和有影响力的人帮助打击虚假信息和促进民主。【原文：Europe is looking to online platforms and influencers to help fight disinformation and promote democracy according to a European Commission strategy presented on Wednesday amid concerns over interference by foreign governments in national elections.】

item.title: Polestar计划反向拆股，以保持纳斯达克上市地位，因为亏损不断增加
item.description: Polestar 周三表示，公司将进行反向拆股，即减少现有股票数量，同时增加股票价值，因为这家亏损的电动汽车制造商正努力保住在纳斯达克的上市地位。【原文：Polestar said on Wednesday it would conduct a reverse stock split - reducing the number of its existing shares while increasing their value - as the loss-making electric vehicle maker strives to retain its Nasdaq listing.】

item.title: Teradar 瞄准 200 亿美元市场，为自动驾驶汽车提供更便宜的全天候传感器
item.description: Teradar 公司周三表示，该公司筹集了 1.5 亿美元，并发布了一种新型 "太赫兹视觉 "传感器，称这种传感器可以使全天候、高分辨率的传感变得更便宜、更耐用，从而颠覆汽车雷达和激光雷达市场。【原文：Teradar on Wednesday said it raised $150 million and unveiled a new "terahertz-vision" sensor that it says could disrupt the automotive radar and lidar market by making all-weather, high-resolution sensing cheaper and more durable.】

item.title: 早间竞标：科技动荡与数据洪流
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 稳定币增长，Circle 季度收入大增
item.description: 本周三，Circle 公司报告称，由于稳定币发行量增加，其旗舰产品 USDC 的储备金收入也随之增加，第三季度收入猛增了 66%。【原文：Circle reported a 66% jump in third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, on the back of higher reserve income through its flagship USDC as stablecoin circulation increased.】

item.title: 美国股市期货上涨，投资者欢呼联邦关门可能结束
item.description: 华尔街期货周三走高，原因是投资者对美国政府可能结束历时最长的停摆感到高兴，同时，先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）乐观的盈利前景重燃了对人工智能的乐观情绪。【原文：Wall Street futures ticked higher on Wednesday as investors cheered a possible end to the longest U.S. government shutdown, while an upbeat earnings outlook from Advanced Micro Devices revived optimism around AI.】

item.title: 自动驾驶卡车公司 Einride 将通过 SPAC 交易上市，估值 18 亿美元
item.description: 瑞典自动驾驶卡车公司 Einride 周三表示，已同意通过与空白支票公司 Legato Merger Corp III 合并的方式在美国上市，交易估值为 18 亿美元。【原文：Swedish autonomous trucking company Einride said on Wednesday it has agreed to go public in the U.S. through a merger with blank-check firm Legato Merger Corp III in a deal valuing the company at $1.8 billion.】

item.title: 美国众议院将就结束史上最长政府停摆的协议进行表决
item.description: 众议院将试图结束美国历史上持续时间最长的政府关门，就一项临时拨款方案进行投票，以重新启动中断的食品援助，支付数十万联邦工作人员的工资，并恢复陷入困境的空中交通管制系统。【原文：The House of Representatives will try to end the longest government shutdown in U.S. history, with a vote on a stopgap funding package to restart disrupted food assistance, pay hundreds of thousands of federal workers and revive a hobbled air-traffic control system.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮催生新一轮法律科技投资浪潮
item.description: 最近几周，投资者向为律师提供人工智能产品的初创公司注入了超过 7.5 亿美元的新现金，押注于争夺法律行业客户的不断增长的市场。【原文：Investors in recent weeks have injected more than $750 million in new cash into startups that make artificial intelligence products for lawyers, betting on a growing marketplace competing for legal industry customers.】

item.title: 微软扩建丹麦量子设施，建立第二个实验室
item.description: 微软公司周三表示，它正在丹麦首都哥本哈根郊外扩建其量子设施，在北欧国家建立第二个实验室，同时也是全球最大的量子基地。【原文：Microsoft on Wednesday said it is expanding its quantum facility just outside the Danish capital Copenhagen, by building its second lab in the Nordic country and its largest quantum site globally.】

item.title: 由于担心特朗普的搜捕行动，一些西班牙裔购物者转而选择安全的网上购物方式
item.description: 特朗普政府扩大移民执法范围的做法改变了一些拉美裔消费者的生活习惯，零售企业也因此受到损害。【原文：The expanded approach to immigration enforcement by the Trump administration has changed the routine for some Hispanic consumers, and retail businesses are hurting because of it.】

item.title: IBM 称 "Loon "芯片指明了到 2029 年实现实用量子计算机的道路
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（IBM）周三宣布，它已制造出一种名为 "Loon "的新型实验性量子计算芯片，这表明它向着在本十年结束前制造出有用的量子计算机的目标迈出了关键的一步。【原文：IBM announced on Wednesday it has built a new experimental quantum computing chip called Loon that demonstrates it hit a key milestone toward making useful quantum computers before the end of the decade.】

item.title: 投资者为长期增长目标欢呼，AMD 股价攀升
item.description: AMD 周三在盘前交易中股价上涨近 5%，此前一天，该公司制定了雄心勃勃的计划，希望通过从 Nvidia 手中抢占更大的人工智能市场份额，在五年内使数据中心年收入达到 1000 亿美元。【原文：AMD shares rose nearly 5% in premarket trading on Wednesday, a day after it laid out ambitious plans to reach $100 billion in annual data center revenue in five years by taking a bigger slice of the AI market from Nvidia .】

item.title: 意法半导体首席执行官奇瑞认为第一季度营收将保持平常水平
item.description: 意法半导体首席执行官让-马克-谢里（Jean-Marc Chery）表示，他预计 2026 年将从正常水平开始，并指出今年的复苏弱于预期不会导致库存调整。【原文：STMicroelectronics' Chief Executive Jean-Marc Chery said he expects 2026 to start at usual levels, noting that a weaker recovery than expected this year will not lead to inventory adjustments.】
